data.title: Broken syntax highlighting in JavaScript template strings with 'Light' or 'Dark' themes
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.10.2 (8076a19fdcab7e1fc1707952d652f0bb6c6db331, 2017-03-08T14:02:52.799Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|vs-keybindings|ms-vscode|0.1.3|;

---

In JavaScript, when using template strings like this:

    `My name is ${name}`

the variable 'name' is the same color as the rest of the string instead of white. This is only present when using 'Light' and 'Dark' themes and not in 'Light+' and 'Dark+'.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15179595/24265455/4c6f94a0-100c-11e7-94ec-a206139cd8c3.png)

data.title: Stuck at downloading
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: v1.10.2
- OS Version: Windows 7 Ultimate (32-bit)
- CPU: Intel Dual-core
- GPU: 128Mb

## Why need `vscode`
 I am newbie and want to try it as in much of articles peoples told that VS-Code is very nice.

## Descripe issue
I am not able to download app, then used VPN (Betternet, Chrome WIN) to download and worked.
Then tried to download extenstion and stuck at installing...

## What exatly issue?
I can't install extension, how i can use this (or install extension, how?)

## Use VPN as you used for downloading
Sorry, but in my country VPN is very high-cost (restriced at all, but have providers). I am using Betternet (free VPN), if some providers know, yeppp. I can't say anything else about it (sorry :( )

## @Microsoft can't help with that, then?
All is ok, i am just wanna try it as looks good and fast.
Some peoples said, you can easily learn TypeScript with it.
Learned ES6 with ES6 apps and i have 2-3 apps (ES6 coded), but i am want TS (it's another story) and ESLint + NPM + Git intergation (all of these has in VS-Code)

## @dalisoft, you is bad, it's your issue, not of me?
Maybe, but i hoped you're can help me.

## NOTE from @dalisoft
If this issue not resolve (or can't be), pls let me know alternative editors with that powered feauture, also fast should be. (Atom is too slow, Sublime is not good looks color scheme, Notepad++ lost my code when pc shutdown suddenly or crash, bla bla bla)

Thanks guys, you are nice.
Starting from Windows to latest app you are best.

data.title: [Feature Request] Drawing pad integrated to github?
data.body:
This is a wishlist/not a priority just a thought that came to mind today.

A simple drawing pad where you get a canvas (instead of the code editor pane) and you draw with your mouse (simple UI example/flow diagram/etc...) and then you could share it to someone else who also uses Visual Studio Code.

I realize this would come with potential new problems like 'How big is the brush? Colors... etc...' Also probably not a good idea to mix non-coding stuff to an IDE for instance I suppose it could be possible to get real-time "push notifications" in the IDE to let you know "hey someone uploaded a file with you mentioned" which could be distracting.

It would be cool if you could upload this into GitHub from Visual Studio Code like 'Save to GitHub'

Yeah it's just a thought, I imagine the various contributors/people who have to actually develop the feature requests/fix things are already burdened with a lot of work.

I also believe that I can do it myself as well (learning the extension creation process).

Also niche use case.

VS code extensions are written in JavaScript not C# or something like that? If that's the case at least I'm closer to that than something like C#.

data.title: Debug controls cover editor tabs!
data.body:
I find that I'm constantly moving the debug controls around to see the editor tabs!
It's really annoying!

- VSCode Version: Version 1.10.2 (1.10.2)
- OS Version: OSX

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a bunch of tabs
2. Start debugging
3. Having multiple debug sessions running increases the problem because the controls become wider and cover even more tabs! I have multiple sessions running a lot for server, message queue and client side debugging.

I would prefer to have the debug toolbar in the debug console (beside the clear console button) 

Or the debug sidebar (above the call stack would make logical sense grouping things related where the debugger currently is).

Or have it beside the editor tabs not overlaying them but this isn't ideal either because it reduces the space available for tabs.

Or overlay the status bar at the bottom! There's tons of blank space there in the middle and the status bar already turns orange when a debug session is active. 

Or just just add a toolbar row at the top and shift the top of the editor tabs/sidebar down

Ideally there would be customizable preferences for how to display the debug controls so you could have it in any or all of these places!

data.title: Add option to auto refresh files from disk, even if they have been modified in the editor
data.body:
**VSCode Version:** 1.10.2
**OS Version:** macOS 10.12.3

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1. Open editor
2. Modify a file in your git repository, but don't save it
3. Checkout a different branch that touches the same file
4. Go back to the editor and try to save
5. ERROR: "Failed to save 'file1': The content on disk is newer. Click on Compare to compare your version with the one on disk."

What I would like to see is the files being reload from the disk every time. With git I don't have to worry about losing history.
Add an `editor.autoReload` option in order to control this behaviour. Possible parameters:
* `Always` - reload from disk
* `Confirm` - show a popup/toast notification
* `Never` - current behaviour?

Similar to how SublimeText works. If the files change in disk they automatically get reload, independently of their current state in the editor. Personally, I prefer having the editor reloading when changing branches than having to confirm the reloads with popups.

Took the idea from @rmunn on [#23043](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/23043#issuecomment-288601201) issue. Decided it was best to create a separate issue for this.

milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Ref: #17549

- Removed the 'alias' from ICommandAction as used semantically inappropriately.
- Added localised abstraction for title and category to keep original command unlocalized string from package.nls.json  in memory.
- Amended ExtensionManifestNLSReplacer parsing to include original message bundles in order to keep the original command title and category contribution.

data.title: Coffeescript: problem with slash "/"
data.body:
In my `.coffee` files, I have a problem with big chunks of code seen in red (it's not a comment, don't know what kind of text is that), caused by slashs (used for division). 
Although it's not Blocker, vissually is really unconfortable.

- VSCode Version: 1.10.2
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04 LTS

Steps to Reproduce:
![selection_059](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9086991/24255627/c90cc174-0fc4-11e7-81eb-a9e6818d8f0a.png)
A simple example. Copy in `.coffee` file to reproduce.
```
      when (punto == null and number > 0 and othernumber > 0)
        number / Math.pow(punto / 100 + 1, othernumber / 365)
      else
        null

  ### Settings ###
  lakdlakslahafaf

  /
  Hello
```

data.title: Control-F find history
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10
- OS Version: Windows 10

Very closely related to https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/18735

This is a feature request.  The UX around `find` is the one place where VS Code is not quite perfect - which speaks volumes to how wonderful this editor is.  Wonderful job.

Basically, it would be great if, inside the `Find` box you could hit the down arrow and get a dropdown of prior searches which you could navigate between to re-search.

data.title: Multi-edit changing quotes doesn't quite work
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.10.2 (8076a19fdcab7e1fc1707952d652f0bb6c6db331, 2017-03-08T13:56:35.908Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.3.0
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|vscode-docker|PeterJausovec|0.0.12|
|jsx|TwentyChung|0.0.1|
|vscode-great-icons|emmanuelbeziat|1.1.44|
|hopscotch|idleberg|0.1.4|
|Go|lukehoban|0.6.55|
|vscode-react-native|vsmobile|0.3.1|
|vscode-proto3|zxh404|0.1.0|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Type some code using double quotes:

```
{
  "field": "value",
  "field2": "value",
  "field3": "value",
  "field4": "value"
}
```

2. Select the first quote `"`
3. Press Cmd+D to select all quotes in the block one at a time
4. Delete the double-quote
5. Type a replacement single quote
6. Notice you get duplicated single quotes at the end

```
{
  'field': 'value',
  'field2': 'value',
  'field3': 'value',
  'field4': 'value''
}
```

* This problem manifests in lots of ways

data.title: Markdown preview window reduces in size when UI is zoomed
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.10.2 (8076a19fdcab7e1fc1707952d652f0bb6c6db331, 2017-03-08T14:02:52.799Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|vscode-markdownlint|DavidAnson|0.7.0|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.7|
|gitlens|eamodio|2.12.2|
|tslint|eg2|0.8.1|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Set zoom to 100% (e.g. press Ctrl+NumPad0)
2. Open a Markdown document in Preview mode (e.g. Release Notes)
3. Increase the zoom level by pressing Ctrl+=
4. Observe that a large blank area has appeared to the right and bottom of the preview
5. Increase the zoom level again by pressing Ctrl+=
6. Observe that the blank area has increased in size

The preview should occupy the whole client area of the tab, with no margin.

100% zoom:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16961013/24248555/d62fd15e-0fc7-11e7-9e87-5cd1eb603da0.png)

After step 3:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16961013/24248627/149db348-0fc8-11e7-95cb-8cd5f47c617d.png)

After step 5:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16961013/24248650/23608d4c-0fc8-11e7-8333-02ee76f4ad3d.png)

data.title: Support command line arguments for portable installations

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.0-insider
- OS Version: win7

I'm running a portable VSCode installation by using the following cmd-file:

```batch
@echo off
setlocal
set VSCODE_DEV=
set ELECTRON_RUN_AS_NODE=1
call "%~dp0..\Code - Insiders.exe" "%~dp0..\resources\app\out\cli.js" %1 --user-data-dir "%~dp0..\data" --extensions-dir "%~dp0..\extensions"
endlocal
```
When i call it like this:

`code-insiders-portable.cmd --install-extension vscode.vsix`

nothing happens. Same with `--list-extensions`, even though there are extensions installed. The only other way is through the UI, which isn't feasible when there are many users.
Please make it possible to install extensions like this.

data.title: Cannot watch variable on Golang remote debug
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.10.2
- OS Version: OS X 10.11.6
- Delve Debugger Version: 0.12.1

I can debug my code using mode `test` and `debug` so I assume my Delve works well.
However I cannot watch variable nor call stack when doing remote debug.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. My `launch.json`

```
        {
        "name": "Remote",
        "type": "go",
        "request": "launch",        
        "mode": "exec",
        "port": 12899,
        "host": "127.0.0.1",
        "program": "${workspaceRoot}/bin/server",
        "args": ["-conf", "./conf/dev.conf"]
        }
```
2. My application is a simple Restful API server and I just send a request to `http://127.0.0.1:12899/system/event/`

3. The cursor goes to the breakpoint but I can not watch local variable `sortSpec ` nor const `MGO_SYSTEM_DB `

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4282367/24245114/82a38b68-0ffc-11e7-9fa3-3954e7716c28.png)

data.title: Debugger crashes after ca 10s
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.10.2
- Nodejs version: 6.9.5
- OS Version: Win7

First of all: Thanks to @weinand for helping and answering similar issues which helped me progress in running the debugger.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Using electron-forge
2. Debugger setting contains the following setup: (following @weinand [help note](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/7583#issuecomment-279535031)s)

`"runtimeExecutable": "${workspaceRoot}/node_modules/.bin/electron-forge.cmd",`
`"program": "${workspaceRoot}/src/index.js",`
 `"runtimeArgs": [
          "start" 
      ]
`

ergo no need to set --debug-brk in the runtimeArgs. 

> And that will run something like: node_modules/.bin/electron-forge.cmd --debug-brk=46736 start src\index.js

3- The debugger starts and runs about 10 seconds before crashing with error:

> ## Cannot connect to runtime via 'legacy' protocol; consider using 'inspector' protocol (timeout after 10000 ms)

Checking on vscode documentation page:

> 
Runtime	node.js:
------------------
- 'Legacy Protocol': **< 8.x**	      
- 'Inspector Protocol': **>= 6.3 (Windows: >= 6.9)**

Runtime Electron:
-------------------
- 'Legacy Protocol': **all**	      
- 'Inspector Protocol':      **not yet**

So what's the case now? Electron-forge is not supported or is there something vscode could fix?

_P.S. ran the debugger before successfully from a transpiled folder using electron ._ 

Thanks in advance!

data.title: [Terminal] Output stops printing when file tab context menu is invoked

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Hi,

- VSCode Version: 1.10.2
- OS Version: macOS

Steps to Reproduce:

1. run r.g. test in terminal which prints a lot of output
2. during the run right click some open file tab to see its context menu
3. profit...printing output to terminal stops.

And what's worse, when you hide that context menu, the printing continues again, so far so good, but the output which should be printed during the context menu appearance is **not** printed to terminal output. Only new output continues to be printed.

Thanks.
